intro: Schizanthus laetus, commonly known as the happy face flower, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Solanaceae family, which includes tomatoes and potatoes, and is characterized by its vibrant, showy flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers in shades of yellow, orange, and red. Its foliage consists of heart-shaped, dark green leaves, and it thrives in full sun with well-drained soil. Schizanthus laetus is popular in gardens for its ornamental value and ease of cultivation.
